definition: to mortgage/to pawn/to detain in custody/to escort and protect/(literary) to sign
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc

first of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/(used for an unspecified person or thing)/first (in a list, as a party to a contract etc)/letter "A" or roman "I" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/armor plating/shell or carapace/(of the fingers or toes) nail/bladed leather or metal armor (old)/ranking system used in the Imperial examinations (old)/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)/ancient Chinese compass point: 75°
to provide (an asset) as security for a loan/to put up collateral
to imprison/to lock up (in jail)
to detain/to hold in custody/to distrain/to seize property
deposit/down payment
to detain/to take into custody/detention/imprisonment
to send away under escort (criminals, goods etc)
to escort (goods or funds)/to convey under guard
to send under escort/to transport a detainee
in custody/to keep sb in detention
to arrest/to take into custody
to play yabao (a gambling game)/(fig.) to gamble on/to take one's chance/to try one's luck
supercargo (in maritime law)/agent responsible for goods/an escort
security (property held against a loan)/mortgaged property
to detain/to take into custody/to imprison temporarily
to sign/to make one's mark

sentences.english: We can explore any product of your remand .
sentences.chinese: 我们可以探索任何产品的押。

sentences.english: He was hauled before the judge.
He wanted to win the horse No. 12 by straining his luck.
sentences.chinese: 他想凭他运气把赌注押在了12号马上。

sentences.english: The accused was remanded in custody for a week.
Both arms folded and he'd push most of his chips into the betting circle.
sentences.chinese: 两臂折叠起来告诉他应该把大部分的筹码都押上。

sentences.english: And the sons of Zeruiah; Abishai, and Joab, and Asahel, three.
sentences.chinese: 洗鲁雅的儿子是亚比筛，约押，亚撒黑，共三人。

sentences.english: When David heard of it, he sent Joab and all the army of the mighty men.
sentences.chinese: 大卫听见了，就差派约押统带勇猛的全军出去。

sentences.english: And Absalom her brother said unto her, Hath Amnon thy brother been with thee?
sentences.chinese: 她胞兄押沙龙问她说，莫非你哥哥暗嫩与你亲近了吗。

sentences.english: Mr. Zhu was charged with first-degree murder and was being held at the Montgomery County Jail.
sentences.chinese: 朱海洋被控一级谋杀目前被押于蒙哥马利郡监狱。

sentences.english: His grandmother's name was Maacah daughter of Abishalom.
sentences.chinese: 他祖母名叫玛迦，是押沙龙的女儿。

sentences.english: And Joab put the words in her mouth.
sentences.chinese: 于是约押将当说的话教导了妇人。

sentences.english: So Absalom returned to his own house, and saw not the king's face.
sentences.chinese: 押沙龙就回自己家里去，没有见王的面。

sentences.english: Of Zebulun; Eliab the son of Helon.
sentences.chinese: 属西布伦的，有希伦的儿子以利押。

sentences.english: He built up the city around it, from the supporting terraces to the surrounding wall, while Joab restored the rest of the city.
sentences.chinese: 大卫又从米罗起，四围建筑城墙，其余的是约押修理。

sentences.english: The result: "I drove as if my life depended on it."
sentences.chinese: 结果“我把命都押在驾驶技术上了。”

sentences.english: 55 and the clans of scribes who lived at Jabez: the Tirathites, Shimeathites and Sucathites.
sentences.chinese: 和住雅比斯众文士家的特拉人，示米押人，苏甲人。

criminal/culprit/suspect (old)

to detain/to take into custody/to imprison temporarily
surname Fu
to pay/to hand over to/classifier for pairs or sets of things

to pierce through/to pass through/to be stringed together/string of 1000 cash
payment to a porter

tip
